intro: Oxydectes erythroxyloides, commonly known as the redwood tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to the eastern coast of Australia and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and elongated, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by woody capsules containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and rainforest environments. Oxydectes erythroxyloides plays an important ecological role in providing habitat and food for various native wildlife species.
